report_description: The PortalFuse Weekly Security Update Report is a resource for System Administrators and Security Professionals looking to keep their systems secure. With a comprehensive compilation of Microsoft Security Response Center posts and Microsoft Support documentation, users can easily access critical KB articles and update packages for their Windows devices without having to spend time searching across multiple sources. This report helps busy Microsoft professionals to stay up-to-date with security issues and new features.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2024-5274 Type Confusion in V8
section_1_data.description:
This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024) for more information.

Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.
section_1_data.summary: CVE-2024-5274 is a type confusion vulnerability in the V8 JavaScript engine used by Chromium, which is also consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). This vulnerability has been actively exploited in the wild. The issue has been addressed in the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based), version 125.0.2535.67, which incorporates the necessary fixes from the Chromium project. System administrators should ensure that their Microsoft Edge installations are updated to this latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For further details, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.

System administrators should ensure that their Microsoft Edge installations are updated to this latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For further details, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.'}

This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see  
Google Chrome Releases 
 for more information. 
Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild. 
Why is this Chrome CVE included in the Security Update Guide? 
The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). It is being documented in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. 
How can I see the version of the browser? 
In your Microsoft Edge browser, click on the 3 dots (...) on the very right-hand side of the window

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2024-5160 Heap buffer overflow in Dawn
section_1_data.description: This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024) for more information.
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a heap buffer overflow vulnerability in Dawn, identified as CVE-2024-5160. This vulnerability was assigned by Chrome and is addressed by ingesting Chromium. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 125.0.2535.67. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024) page.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2024-5159 Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE
section_1_data.description: This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024) for more information.
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a heap buffer overflow vulnerability in ANGLE, identified as CVE-2024-5159. This vulnerability was assigned by Chrome and is addressed by ingesting Chromium. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2024-5158 Type Confusion in V8
section_1_data.description: This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024) for more information.
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a type confusion vulnerability in the V8 JavaScript engine, identified as CVE-2024-5158. This vulnerability was assigned by Chrome and is addressed by ingesting the latest Chromium updates. The flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) has incorporated the necessary Chromium updates and is no longer vulnerable. System administrators should ensure that their Microsoft Edge installations are updated to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.

This vulnerability was assigned by Chrome and is addressed by ingesting the latest Chromium updates. The flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) has incorporated the necessary Chromium updates and is no longer vulnerable. System administrators should ensure that their Microsoft Edge installations are updated to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.'}

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2024-5157 Use after free in Scheduling
section_1_data.description: This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024) for more information.
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a use after free vulnerability in Scheduling, identified as CVE-2024-5157. This vulnerability was assigned by Chrome and is addressed by ingesting Chromium. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has documented this in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024) page.

FAQ 
Why is this Chrome CVE included in the Security Update Guide? 
The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). It is being documented in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. 
How can I see the version of the browser? 
In your Microsoft Edge browser, click on the 3 dots (...) on the very right-hand side of the window
